titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Albert Steamburgin & James Jones, Indictment
CWG5225

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Barren Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Ky
Agst }
Albert Steamburgin &
James Jones

The Grand Jury of Barren County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Albert Steamburgin & James Jones of the crime of horse Stealing commited as follows towit the said Albert Steambergin and James Jones on the 3rd day of Feb 1865 in the County aforesaid did feloniously take steal and carry away one horse the property of Joseph Peck which said horse was there and there of the value of fifty Dollars.
Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

J H C Sandidge
Atty for Comth
A copy Attest
W. L. Porter clk
By Loring Cox D C
The Comth
vs } Copy Indictment
Albert Steamburgin
& James Jones
